items.sourceText: Rocky signed with Bhayangkara to play in the Indonesian Liga 2 for the 2020 season. This season was suspended on 27 March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The season was abandoned and was declared void on 20 January 2021.

targets.targetText: Rocky ya rattaba hannu tare da Bhayangkara don taka leda a gasar La Liga 2 ta Indonesia na kakar 2020. An dakatar da wannan kakar a ranar 27 ga Maris 2020 saboda cutar ta COVID-19 . An yi watsi da kakar kuma an ayyana ba komai a ranar 20 ga Janairu 2021.

Rocky ya rattaba gwagwala hannu tare da Bhayangkara don taka leda a gasar La Liga 2 ta Indonesia na kakar gwagwala 2020. An dakatar da wannan kakar a ranar 27 ga Maris 2020 saboda cutar ta COVID-19 . An yi watsi da kakar gwagwala kuma an ayyana ba komai a ranar 20 ga Janairu gwagwala 2021.

items.sourceText: Her work has been directly linked to Surrealism. In the early period, she joined a circle of young artists centered around Karel Teige.[4] From 1947 to 1951, she and Mikuláš Medek created collections of staged photographs. She married him on 12 September 1951. From the early 1950s, she focused on creating several loosely overlapping thematic cycles that went through her whole career, up to her death. At the turn of the 1950s and 1960s, she became a leading exponent of the Czech Informel photography.[5] Although she found inspiration mainly in Prague, she created extensive photographic cycles of Paris (1966) and Italy (1967).[6] The life and work of Medková were covered in a monograph designed by art historians Karel Srp and Lenka Bydžovská, curators of her first comprehensive exhibition, held in 2001.

targets.targetText: Aikin ta yana da alaƙa kai tsaye zuwa Surrealism. A farkon lokacin, ta shiga cikin da'irar matasa masu fasaha da ke kewaye da Karel Teige . [1] Daga 1947 zuwa 1951, ita da Mikuláš Medek sun ƙirƙiri tarin hotu nan da aka tsara. Ta aure shi a ranar 12 ga Satumba, 1951. Daga farkon shekarun 1950, ta mai da hankali kan ƙirƙirar zagayowar jigogi da yawa waɗan da suka bi ta gaba ɗayan aikin ta, har zuwa mutuwar ta. A farkon shekarun 1950 da 1960, ta zama jagorar mai gabatar da hoton Czech Informel . [2] Ko da yake ta sami kwarin gwiwa musamman a Prague, ta ƙirƙira ɗaru ruwan hotu nan hoto na Paris (1966) da Italiya (1967). [3] Rayuwa da aikin Medková an rufe su a cikin littafin tarihin da masana tarihi Karel Srp da Lenka Bydžovská suka tsara, masu kula da baje kolin nata na farko, wanda aka gudanar a shekara ta 2001.

Aikinta yana da alaƙa kai tsaye zuwa Surrealism. A farkon lokacin, ta shiga cikin da'irar matasa masu fasaha da ke kewaye da Karel Teige . [1] Daga 1947 zuwa 1951, ita da Mikuláš Medek sun ƙirƙiri tarin hotunan da aka tsara. Ta aure shi a ranar 12 ga Satumba, 1951. Daga farkon shekarun 1950, ta mai da hankali kan ƙirƙirar zagayowar jigogi da yawa waɗanda suka bi ta gabaɗayan aikinta, har zuwa mutuwarta. A farkon shekarun 1950 da 1960, ta zama jagorar mai gabatar da hoton Czech Informel . [2] Ko da yake ta sami kwarin gwiwa musamman a Prague, ta ƙirƙira ɗaruruwan hotunan hoto na Paris (1966) da Italiya (1967). [3] Rayuwa da aikin Medková an rufe su a cikin littafin tarihin da masana tarihi Karel Srp da Lenka Bydžovská suka tsara, masu kula da baje kolin nata na farko, wanda aka gudanar a shekara ta 2001.

items.sourceText: Haseena Begum (Urdu: حسینہ بیگم; born 1 January 1961) is a Pakistani politician who was a Member of the Provincial Assembly of the Punjab, from May 2013 to May 2018.

items.sourceText: In 2021, Ahmad Ihwan signed a contract with Indonesian Liga 2 club PSIM Yogyakarta.[5] He made his league debut on 26 September in a 1–0 loss against PSCS Cilacap at the Manahan Stadium, Surakarta.[6]

[1] Ya buga wasansa na farko na gasar a gwagwala ranar 26 ga Satumba a gwagwala cikin rashin nasara da ci 1-0 da PSCS Cilacap a filin wasa na Manahan, Surakarta . [2]

items.sourceText: Arcand was born in 1982 in Hafford, Saskatchewan. She grew up on Muskeg Lake Cree Nation in central Saskatchewan. She spent many summers working in the Muskeg Lake Archives which gave Arcand her love of old photographs and history.[4] Arcand later attended the University of Saskatchewan where she received a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree with Great Distinction in 2005.[5] She began making artwork that addressed her identity in the second year of her studies at the University, at which point she decided to focus on photography and printmaking. Her first photography projects were in direct response to the images of photographer Edward S. Curtis, who was working in the early 1900s.[3]

targets.targetText: An haifi Arcand a cikin 1982 a Hafford, Saskatchewan . Ta girma a Muskeg Lake Cree Nation a tsakiyar Saskatchewan. Ta shafe lokacin bazara da yawa tana aiki a cikin Tarihi na Muskeg Lake wanda ya ba Arcand ƙaunar tsohon hotuna da tarihi. [1] Daga baya Arcand ta halarci Jami'ar Saskatchewan inda ta sami digiri na Fine Arts tare da Babban Bambanci a cikin 2005. [2] Ta fara yin zane-zanen da ke bayyana matsayinta a shekara ta biyu na karatunta a Jami'ar, inda ta yanke shawarar mayar da hankali kan daukar hoto da buga littattafai. Ayyukan daukar hoto na farko sun kasance cikin amsa kai tsaye ga hotunan mai daukar hoto Edward S. Curtis, wanda ke aiki a farkon 1900s. [3]

An haifi Arcand a cikin 1982 a Hafford, Saskatchewan . Ta girma a Muskeg Lake Cree Nation a tsaki yar Saskatchewan. Ta shafe lokacin bazara da yawa tana aiki a cikin Tarihi na Muskeg Lake wan da ya ba Arcand ƙaunar tsohon hotuna da tarihi. [1] Daga baya Arcand ta halarci Jami'ar Saskatchewan in da ta sami digiri na Fine Arts tare da Babban Bamban ci a cikin 2005. [2] Ta fara yin zane-zanen da ke bayya na matsa yin ta a shekara ta biyu na karatun ta a Jami'ar, inda ta yanke shawarar mayar da hankali kan daukar hoto da buga littattafai. Ayyukan daukar hoto na farko sun kasance cikin amsa kai tsaye ga hotunan mai daukar hoto Edward S. Curtis, wanda ke aiki a farkon 1900s. [3]

items.sourceText: Safrudin was signed for PSM Makassar to play in Liga 1 in the 2022–23 season.[6] He made his league debut on 29 August 2022 in a match against Persib Bandung at the Gelora B.J. Habibie Stadium, Parepare.[7]

items.sourceText: The setting and storyline were inspired by Kallos' travels around the remote Eastern Free State region of the country and his encounters with farm families there. The film is a psychological drama that explores themes of belonging, sexual identity and masculinity.[1][2]

items.sourceText: In 2019, Chioma rose to prominence after starring as the lead actress alongside veteran Nollywood actors Zack Orji, Tina Mba, Funsho Adeolu, Norbert Young, Yemi Solade and Gloria Young in Nigerian primetime family TV drama series, Superstory titled Monica.

items.sourceText: On November 18, 1968, Rockwell Manufacturing Co. agreed to purchase Sterling Faucet Co. and the three subsidiaries, Sterling Manufacturing Co., Sterling Tubular Products Inc. and Sterling Faucet Canada Ltd. When the purchase was complete, Sterling Faucet Company became a subsidiary of Rockwell for the following years.[23]

items.sourceText: The life of Hamza ibn Ali and his exact role in the birth of the Druze movement are not entirely clear, as the chief sources about him—the contemporary Christian chronicler Yahya of Antioch, the Muslim historian Ibn Zafir, and Hamza's own epistles—are often contradictory.[1]

targets.targetText: Rayuwar Hamza ibn Ali da ainihin rawar da ya taka wajen haihuwar ƙungiyar Druze ba su da cikakkiyar fahimta, kamar yadda manyan tushe game da shi - marubucin tarihin Kirista na zamani Yahya na Antakiya, masanin tarihin Musulmi Ibn Zafir, da wasiƙun Hamza - galibi suna sabawa.[1]

A Rayuwar Hamza ibn Ali da kuma ainihin rawar da ya taka wajen haihuwar ƙungiyar Druze ba su da cikakkiyar fahimta, kamar yadda manyan tushe game da shi babban marubucin tarihin Kirista ne a zamani Yahya na Antakiya, masanin tarihin Musulmi Ibn Zafir, da wasiƙun Hamza - galibi suna sabawa.[1]

items.sourceText: After the birth of her first child in 2001, Saandati returned to metropolitan France, to Montpellier then in 2005, decided to return to live permanently in her native country.[1]

items.sourceText: In 2017, Agil Munawar signed a contract with Indonesian Liga 1 club PS TNI. He made his league debut on 22 April 2017 in a match against Persib Bandung at the Pakansari Stadium, Cibinong.

targets.targetText: A cikin 2017, Agil Munawar ya sanya hannu kan kwangila tare da kungiyar PS TNI ta Lig 1 ta Indonesia. Ya fara buga wasan farko a ranar 22 ga Afrilu 2017 a wasan da ya yi da Persib Bandung a Filin wasa na Pakansari, Cibinong .

A cikin 2017, Agil Munawar ya sanya hannu gwagwalada kan kwangila tare da kungiyar PS TNI ta Lig 1 ta Indonesia. Ya gwagwalada fara buga wasan farko a ranar 22 ga Afrilu 2017 a wasan da ya yi gwagwalada da Persib Bandung a Filin wasa na Pakansari, Cibinong .

items.sourceText: Malik Risaldi (born 23 October 1996) is an Indonesian professional footballer who plays as a winger for Liga 1 club Persebaya Surabaya and the Indonesia national team.

items.sourceText: In 2021, Rusdiana signed a contract with Indonesian Liga 2 club Persekat Tegal. He made his league debut on 27 September in a 3–1 win against Badak Lampung at the Gelora Bung Karno Madya Stadium, Jakarta.[2]

items.sourceText: In 2018, Imam Arief joined Liga 1 club PSM Makassar, on loan from Persib Bandung. He made his debut on 5 August 2018 in a match against Perseru Serui at the Andi Mattalatta Stadium, Makassar.

A cikin 2018, Imam Arief ya shiga kungiyar Lig 1 ta PSM Makassar, a kan aro daga Persib Bandung . Ya fara bugawa a ranar 5 ga watan Agusta 2018 a wasan da ya yi da Perseru Serui a Filin wasa na Andi Mattalatta, Makassar .

items.sourceText: Muhammad Mishbah Al-Mashuri Handayan (born 5 February 2005) is an Indonesian professional footballer who plays as a attacking midfielder for Lao League 1 club Master 7 FC, on loan from Liga 2 club Nusantara United.

items.sourceText: Erwin Ramdani (born 3 November 1993, in Bandung) is an Indonesian professional footballer who plays as a winger for Liga 1 club RANS Nusantara. He is also an active Indonesian Army soldier.[2]

items.sourceText: Beckham Putra Nugraha (born 29 October 2001), commonly known as Etam, is an Indonesian professional footballer who plays as an attacking midfielder or a winger for Liga 1 club Persib Bandung.

items.sourceText: Talha or Thalha is an Arabic masculine given name, meaning "fruitful tree from heaven".[1] Talha is the name of a well-known sahabi (companion) of the Islamic prophet Muhammad, Talha ibn Ubayd Allah. He is renowned for saving Muhammad's face from an arrow by holding his hand in the way.

targets.targetText: Talha ko Thalha sunan namiji ne na Larabci, ma'ana "itace mai 'ya'yan itace daga sama".[1] Talha shine sunan sanannen Sahabi (aboki) na Annabi Musulunci Muhammadu, Talha ibn Ubayd Allah . An san shi da ceton fuskar Muhammadu daga kibiya ta hanyar riƙe hannunsa a hanya.

Muhammad Ammar kuma ya faru ne a Talha ko Thalha sunan namiji ne na Larabci, ma'ana "itace mai 'ya'yan itace daga sama".[1] Talha shine sunan sanannen Sahabi (aboki) na Annabi Musulunci Muhammadu, Talha ibn Ubayd Allah . An san shi da ceton fuskar Muhammadu daga kibiya ta hanyar riƙe hannunsa a hanya.

items.sourceText: Qusai Kheder (Arabic: قصي خضر‎, born 1978), known by the stage name Qusai, is a Saudi American hip hop artist, singer/songwriter, record producer, rapper, television personality, voice actor and DJ. He is the first professional Saudi hip hop artist.[1][2]

Shine kwararren mawakin hip hop na Saudiyya. [1] [2]

items.sourceText: The Monastery of Saint Pishoy (also spelled Bishoy, Pshoi, or Bishoi[1]) in Wadi El Natrun, Beheira Governorate, Egypt, is the most famous monastery of the Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria named after Pishoy. It is the easternmost of the four current monasteries of Wadi el Natrun.

targets.targetText: Sanin sufi na Saint Pishoy (wanda aka rubuta har da Bishoy, Paliyo, ko Bishoi [1] ) a Wadi El Natrun, Beheira Governorate, Misira, sanannen gidan sufi ne na Cocin Orthodox na Coptic na Alexandria wanda ake kira da Pishoy . Wannan shine gabas mafi girma daga gidajen ibada guda huɗu na Wadi el Natrun. What time and the day of repeat

items.sourceText: Cueras (or Santa Eulalia de Cueras) is one of 54 parishes in Cangas del Narcea, a municipality within the province and autonomous community of Asturias, in northern Spain.

items.sourceText: The Autostrada A24 or “Parks Motorway”, is a highway connecting Rome to the Adriatic Sea. Starting from GRA and ending to Teramo, the A24 create a new historical linkage between Rome and the insidious apennine mountains, alongside long-time roads Salaria, Flaminia and Tiburtina Valeria.

targets.targetText: Autostrada A24 ko "Hanyar Hanyar Parks ", babbar hanya ce da ta haɗa Rome zuwa Tekun Adriatic . Farawa daga GRA kuma ya ƙare zuwa Teramo, A24 ya kirkiro sabon alaƙar tarihi tsakanin Rome da tsaunukan apennine masu ɓarna, tare da dogayen hanyoyin Salaria, Flaminia da Tiburtina Valeria .

Autostrada A24 ko "Hanyar Hanyar Parks "ya kasan ce wani , babbar hanya ce da ta haɗa Rome zuwa Tekun Adriatic . items.sourceText: The River Niger Bridge in Onitsha (also known as the Onitsha Bridge), Anambra State, Nigeria connects southeastern Nigeria with western Nigeria over the Niger River. It is linked to Asaba in Delta State, Nigeria.

items.sourceText: The organization of labor was commonly resisted during the 19th century, with even relatively liberal countries such as the United Kingdom banning it for various periods (in the UK's case, between 1820 and 1824).[9]

items.sourceText: Hidayat won the men's singles gold medal at the Asian Games in 2002 Busan and 2006 Doha. He also won the 2007 Asian Championship, and two men's singles gold medals at the Southeast Asian Games in 1999 Bandar Seri Begawan and 2007 Nakhon Ratchasima.

items.sourceText: After WWII the creation of the European project led to the opening of borders, especially for citizens since these control were almost absent before 1914.[2] The Treaties of Rome laid down the foundations of the so-called "four freedoms in the EU. Initially they were basic for workers, for the free provision of services and the free movement of goods, later on capital movement was included.

[1] Yarjejeniyar Rome ta aza harsashin abin da ake kira "'yanci hudu a cikin EU. items.sourceText: Noah Sadiki (born 17 December 2004) is a Belgian professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for Belgian First Division A club Anderlecht.

items.sourceText: The district of Southall has many other Anglo-Saxon place names such as Elthorne and Waxlow. Its earliest record, from ad 830, is of Warberdus bequeathing Norwood Manor and Southall Manor to the archbishops of Canterbury. [citation needed]

targets.targetText: Gundumar Southall tana da sauran sunayen wuraren Anglo-Saxon da yawa kamar Elthorne da Waxlow. Babban rikodinsa, daga ad 830, shine na Warberdus wanda ya ba da gadar Norwood Manor da Southall Manor ga limaman cocin Canterbury. [abubuwan da ake bukata]r

Gundumar Southall tana da sauran sunayen wuraren Anglo-Saxon da yawa kamar Elthorne da Waxlow. Babban rikodinsa, daga ad 830, shine na Warberdus wanda ya ba da gadar Norwood Manor da Southall Manor ga limaman cocin Canterbury.

items.sourceText: In August 2001, he was appointed head of a delegation from the Arewa Consultative Forum to meet and discuss common goals with Northern state governors and other leaders.[7] In 2003, he was Deputy National Chairman, North for the All Nigeria Peoples Party (ANPP).[8] In November 2004, he was locked in an internal ANPP struggle with Chief Donald Etiebet, the National Chairman.[9]

targets.targetText: A cikin watan Agustan 2001, an nada shi shugaban wata tawaga daga kungiyar tuntuba ta Arewa domin ganawa tare da tattauna muradu daya da gwamnonin jihohin Arewa da sauran shugabanni. [1] A shekarar 2003, ya zama mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar ANPP na kasa ta Arewa. [2] A cikin Nuwamba 2004, an kulle shi a cikin gwagwarmaya na cikin gida na ANPP tare da Cif Donald Etiebet, Shugaban Kasa. [3]

A cikin watan Agustan 2001, an nada shi shugaban wata tawaga daga kungiyar tuntuba ta Arewa domin ganawa tare da tattaunawa akan muradu yanki da gwamnonin jihohin Arewa dan sauran shugabanni. [1] A shekarar 2003, ya zama mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar ANPP na kasa ta Arewa. [2] A cikin Nuwamba 2004, an sakashi shi a cikin gwagwarmaya na cikin gida na ANPP tare da Cif Donald Etiebet, Shugaban jam'iyya ne Kasa. [3]

items.sourceText: Jemaa el-Fnaa (Arabic: ساحة جامع الفناء Sāḥat Jāmiʾ al-Fanāʾ, also Jemaa el-Fna, Djema el-Fna or Djemaa el-Fnaa) is a square and market place in Marrakesh's medina quarter (old city). It remains the main square of Marrakesh, used by locals and tourists.

targets.targetText: Jemaa el-Fnaa ( Arabic Sāḥat al-Fanāʾ, kuma Jemaa el-Fna, Djema el-Fna ko Djemaa el-Fnaa ) fili ne kuma,wurin,kasuwa, ne a cikin kwata, na madina, na Marrakesh, (tsohon birni).Ya kasance babban dandalin Marrakesh, wanda mazauna gida da masu yawon, bude ido ke amfani,

Jemaa el-Fnaa ( Arabic Sāḥat Jāmiʾ al-Fanāʾ, kuma Jemaa el-Fna, Djema el-Fna ko Djemaa el-Fnaa ) fili ne kuma wurin kasuwa a cikin kwata na madina na Marrakesh (tsohon birni). Ya kasance babban dandalin Marrakesh, wanda mazauna gida da masu yawon bude ido ke amfani da shi.

items.sourceText: Carthage (/ˈkɑːrθɪdʒ/ KAR-thij) was a settlement in what is now known as modern Tunisia that later became a city-state and then an empire. Founded by the Phoenicians in the ninth century BC, Carthage reached its height in the fourth century BC as one of the largest metropolises in the world[4] and the centre of the Carthaginian Empire, a major power in the ancient world that dominated the western Mediterranean. Following the Punic Wars, Carthage was destroyed by the Romans in 146 BC, who later rebuilt the city lavishly.[5][6][7]

targets.targetText: Carthage ( / ˈkɑːr θ ɪ dʒ / ) ƙauye ne a cikin abin da a yanzu ake sani da Tunisiya ta zamani wanda daga baya ya zama birni-ƙara sannan kuma daular. Phoenicians ne suka kafa shi a karni na tara BC, Carthage ya kai tsayinsa a karni na hudu BC a matsayin daya daga cikin manyan biranen duniya [1] kuma tsakiyar daular Carthaginian, babban iko a duniyar duniyar da ta mamaye yammacin duniya. Bahar Rum . Bayan Yaƙin Punic, Romawa sun lalata Carthage a cikin 146 BC, waɗanda daga baya suka sake gina birnin da kyau. [2] [3] [4]

Carthage ( / ˈkɑːr θ ɪ dʒ / ) ƙauye ne wanda da a yanzu aka fi sani da Tunisiya ta zamani wanda daga baya ta zama city-state sannan kuma daula. Phoenicians ne suka kafa ta a karni na tara BC, Carthage ya kai tsayinsa a karni na hudu BC a matsayin daya daga cikin manyan biranen duniya [1] kuma tsakiyar daular Carthaginian, babban iko a tsohuwar duniyar da ta mamaye yammacin duniya. Bahar Rum. Bayan Yaƙin Punic, Romawa sun lalata Carthage a cikin 146 BC, waɗanda daga baya suka sake gina birnin ya mai kyau. [2] [3] [4]

items.sourceText: Guindo represented the Under-20 national team from Mali at 2009 African Youth Championship in Rwanda,[5] and was member of the U-17 at CAN 2006,[6] lastly the 2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup.[7]

targets.targetText: Guindo ya wakilci tawagar 'yan kasa da shekaru 20 daga Mali a gasar zakarun matasan Afirka na 2009 a Rwanda, [1] kuma ya kasance memba na U-17 a CAN 2006, [2] a karshe gasar cin kofin duniya ta 2011 FIFA U-20 . [3]

Guindo ya wakilci tawagar 'yan kasa da shekaru 20 daga Mali a gasar zakarun matasan Afirka na 2009 a Rwanda, [1] kuma ya kasance memba na ƙasa da shekaru-17 a CAN 2006, [2] a karshe gasar cin kofin duniya ta 2011 FIFA ƙasa da shekaru-20 . [3]

items.sourceText: Libya has also hosted some international sports tournaments, including the FIDE World Chess Championship 2004 and 2008 African Futsal Championship.

Libya kuma ta karbi bakuncin wasu gasannin wasanni na kasa da kasa, wadanda suka hada da FIDE World Chess Championship 2004 da 2008 Gasar Futsal ta Afirka .

items.sourceText: Mohamed Abdalarasool (Arabic: محمد عبد الرسول; born 24 July 1993) is a Sudanese judoka who competes in the under 73 kg (161 lb) category.[1]

items.sourceText: Early in her career, Nikitiuk worked in a variety of media, writing theater criticism and creating the website Teatre,[1] directing short films,[2] and publishing a collection of short stories (The Abyss, 2016),[3] which won the Oles Ulianenko International Literary Prize.[4]

targets.targetText: A farkon aikinta, Nikitiuk ta yi aiki a cikin kafofin watsa labarai daban-daban, tana rubuta sukar wasan kwaikwayo da ƙirƙirar kafar yanar gizo mai suna Teatre, [1] ta jagoranci gajerun fina-finai, [2] da kuma buga tarin gajerun labarai ( The Abyss, 2016), [3] wanda ya lashe lambar yabo ta adabi ta duniya ta Oles Ulianenko . [4]

items.sourceText: He is best known for finishing fourth in the 4 × 400 metres relay at the 1996 Olympic Games, together with Moustapha Diarra, Hachim Ndiaye and Ibou Faye.[1] The team ran in a Senegalese record.

targets.targetText: Ya shahara wajen kammala na hudu a tseren mita 4 × 400 a wasannin Olympics na 1996, tare da Moustapha Diarra, Hachim Ndiaye da Ibou Faye . [1] Tawagar ta yi gudu a rikodin Senegal .
Ya shahara wajen kammalawa a matsayi na huɗu a tseren mita 4×400 a wasannin Olympics na 1996, tare da Moustapha Diarra, Hachim Ndiaye da Ibou Faye. [1] Tawagar ta yi gudu a rikodin Senegal.

items.sourceText: Mamadou Kassé Hann (born 10 October 1986, Pikine, Senegal[1]) is a Senegalese hurdler.[2] At the 2012 Summer Olympics, he competed in the Men's 400 metres hurdles.[3][4][5] He was a finalist at the 2013 World Championships in Athletics, placing seventh. Hanne was a two-time individual medalist at the African Championships in Athletics.

targets.targetText: Mamadou Kassé Hann (an haife shi 10 ga Oktoba 1986, Pikine, Senegal [1] ) ɗan ƙasar Senegal . [2] A Gasar Olympics ta bazara ta 2012, ya fafata a gasar gudun mita 400 na maza . [2] [3] [4] Ya kasance dan wasan karshe a Gasar Cin Kofin Duniya a 2013, inda ya sanya na bakwai. Hanne ta kasance mai samun lambar yabo sau biyu a gasar zakarun Afirka a wasannin guje-guje da tsalle-tsalle .

Mamadou Kassé Hann (an haife shi a ranar 10 ga watan Oktoba 1986, Pikine, Senegal [1] ) ɗan ƙasar Senegal. [2] A Gasar Olympics ta bazara ta shekarar 2012, ya fafata a gasar gudun mita 400 na maza. [2] [3] [4] Ya kasance dan wasan karshe a Gasar Cin Kofin Duniya a 2013, inda ya zo na bakwai. Hanne ya kasance mai samun lambar yabo sau biyu a gasar zakarun Afirka a wasannin guje-guje da tsalle-tsalle.[5]

items.sourceText: Tchintoulous (also written as Tintellust and Tin Telloust) is a village in the Arlit Department of the Agadez Region of northern-central Niger.

items.sourceText: James competed in badminton at the 2004 Summer Olympics in men's doubles with partner Stewart Carson. They were defeated in the round of 32 by Howard Bach and Kevin Han of the United States.

items.sourceText: At the 2013 IPC Athletics World Championships, Nouiri placed fourth in the shot put and lost his world record to Scott Jones.[4]

items.sourceText: Mendy was born in Mont-Saint-Aignan, France. He started his career in the training centre of Auxerre, moving first to Quevilly, before signing a one-season professional trainee contract with Rennes in June 2006. A year later, having not imposed himself, he left Rennes for Paris FC.[1]

Ya fara aikinsa a cibiyar horo ta Auxerre, ya fara tafiya zuwa Quevilly, kafin ya sanya hannu kan kwantiragin ƙwararrun lokaci guda tare da Rennes a cikin watan Yunin 2006. Bayan shekara guda, bai sanya kansa ba, ya bar Rennes don Paris FC. [1]

items.sourceText: He competed in the 100 m event at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro. He finished 6th in his heat during the preliminary round and did not qualify for the first round of the finals.[3] He was the flagbearer for Mauritania during the Parade of Nations.[4]

Ya kare a matsayi na 6 a cikin zafinsa a lokacin wasan share fage kuma bai samu damar shiga zagayen farko na gasar ba. [1][2] Ya kasance mai ba da tuta ga Mauritania a lokacin faretin kasashe. [3][4]

items.sourceText: He has a daughter, born October 2019, with his wife Zabibu Kiba, the sister of Ali Kiba.[6] The child was initially reported to be a boy.[7]

items.sourceText: Haruna Moshi Shabani (born 31 May 1987) is a Tanzanian professional footballer who plays as an attacking midfielder for Young Africans.

items.sourceText: Muhammad Kanta Kotal, also known as Kanta Kotal, was a Hausa Warrior and Military General who became the first King of Kebbi, now a state in Northern Nigeria. Kanta was the chief in charge of the Province of Lekka (now known as Kebbi), then under the Songhai Empire.[1]

targets.targetText: Muhammad Kanta Kotal wanda aka fi sani da Kanta Kotal Jarumin Hausa ne kuma Janar na Soja wanda ya zama Sarkin Kebbi na farko, a yanzu kebbi jiha ce a Arewacin Najeriya. Kanta shi ne babban mai kula da lardin Lekka (a yanzu wurin ake kira Kebbi), a ƙarƙashin daular Songhai. [1]

Muhammad Kanta Kotal wanda aka fi sani da Kanta Kotal Jarumin Hausa ne kuma Janar na Soja wanda ya zama Sarkin Kebbi na farko a yanzu jiha ce a Arewacin Najeriya . Kanta shi ne babban mai kula da lardin Lekka (a yanzu ake kira Kebbi), sannan a karkashin daular Songhai. [1]

items.sourceText: His personal best in the event is 16.74 metres, set in Windhoek in 2010. This is the current national record.

targets.targetText: Mafi kyawun sa na sirri a cikin wasan shine mita 16.74, wanda aka saita a Windhoek a cikin shekarar 2010. Wannan shine tarihin kasa a halin yanzu.
Mafi kyawun sa na sirri a cikin taron shine mita 16.74, wanda aka saita a Windhoek a cikin 2010. Wannan shine tarihin kasa a halin yanzu .

items.sourceText: He played for the United Sikkim F.C. in the 2012 I-League 2nd Division. On 15 March 2012 he scored a brace which helped his side win 3–2 against Kalighat Milan Sangha F.C. in Siliguri.[7] He had scored 16 goals in 23 matches in the 2nd Division for the Gangtok-based club helping his side win promotion to the 2012-13 I-League.

targets.targetText: Ya buga wa United Sikkim FC wasa a 2012 I-League 2nd Division . A ranar 15 ga Maris 2012 ya zira kwallaye biyun da ya taimaka wa bangarensa su ci 3–2 da Kalighat Milan Sangha FC a Siliguri . [1] Ya zira kwallaye 16 a wasanni 23 a cikin 2nd Division don kungiyar ta Gangtok yana taimaka wa gefensa samun nasara zuwa 2012-13 I-League .

Ya buga wa United Sikkim FC wasa a 2012 I-League 2nd Division. A ranar 15 ga watan Maris 2012 ya zira kwallaye biyun da ya taimaka wa bangarensa su ci 3–2 da Kalighat Milan Sangha FC a Siliguri.[1] [2] Ya zira kwallaye 16 a wasanni 23 a cikin 2nd Division da kungiyar ta Gangtok ya taimaka wa kulob dinsa samun nasara zuwa 2012-13 I-League.

items.sourceText: When Pope Francis made Nzapalainga a cardinal on 19 November 2016 he became the youngest cardinal at the time and the first born after the Second Vatican Council.

targets.targetText: Lokacin da Paparoma Francis ya sanya Nzapalainga a matsayin Cardinal a ranar 19 ga Nuwamba 2016 ya zama Cardinal ƙarami a lokacin kuma ɗan fari bayan Majalisar Vatican ta biyu .

items.sourceText: In August 2008, he was loaned to the Finnish Premier Division side FC Honka.[2] Honka used its option for a permanent move after the season.

targets.targetText: A watan Agustan 2008, an ba da shi rancensa ga ƙungiyar Premier ta Finnish FC Honka.[1] [2] Honka ta yi amfani da zaɓinsa don motsawa na dindindin bayan kakar wasa.
A watan Agustan 2008, an ba shi rance ga ƙungiyar Premier ta Finnish FC Honka . [1] Honka ya yi amfani da zaɓinsa don motsawa na dindindin bayan kakar wasa.

items.sourceText: Sowe began playing with the New York Red Bulls academy in 2018.[6] He also appeared for the club's USL League Two side New York Red Bulls U-23.[7]

targets.targetText: Sowe ya fara wasa tare da makarantar Red Bulls ta New York a cikin 2018. [1] Ya kuma bayyana ga kulob din USL League biyu gefen New York Red Bulls U-23 . [2]

items.sourceText: Birhan Tesfaye Nebebew (born 14 August 1994) is an Ethiopian male long-distance runner who competes in track, road and cross country running.

targets.targetText: Birhan Tesfaye Nebebew (an haife shi a ranar 14 ga watan Agusta 1994) ɗan ƙasar Habasha ne ɗan wasan tsere mai nisa wanda ke fafatawa a tseren guje-guje da tsalle-tsalle.
Birhan Tesfaye Nebebew (an haife shi 14 ga Agusta 1994) ɗan ƙasar Habasha ne mai tsere mai nisa wanda ke fafatawa a tseren guje - guje da tsalle-tsalle .

items.sourceText: At age 17, Aregawi earned bronze in the 10,000 m at the 2018 World Under-20 Championships. He also holds the Ethiopian record in the 10 kilometres.

targets.targetText: Yana da shekaru 17, Aregawi ya sami tagulla a cikin 10,000 m a Gasar Cin Kofin Duniya na 'yan kasa da shekaru 20 na 2018 . Ya kuma rike tarihin kasar Habasha a tseren kilomita 10 .
Yana da shekaru 17, Aregawi ya sami tagulla a cikin tseren 10,000 m a Gasar Cin Kofin Duniya na 'yan kasa da shekaru 20 na shekarar 2018. Ya kuma rike tarihin kasar Habasha a tseren kilomita 10.

items.sourceText: Muktar Edris (born 14 January 1994) is an Ethiopian professional long-distance runner who competes in track and cross country races.

targets.targetText: Muktar Edris (an haife shi 14 ga Janairu 1994) ƙwararren ɗan tseren nesa ne na Habasha wanda ke fafatawa a tseren tsere da tseren ƙasa .
Muktar Edris (an haife shi a ranar 14 ga watan Janairu 1994) ƙwararren ɗan tseren nesa ne na Habasha wanda ke fafatawa a tseren cross-country.

items.sourceText: Hackman made his professional debut in the Primeira Liga for Boavista on 6 December 2015, coming on as a second-half substitute for Anderson Correia in a 2–3 loss to Arouca.[1]

targets.targetText: Hackman ya fara wasansa na farko na ƙwararru a cikin Primeira Liga a Boavista a ranar 6 ga watan Disamba 2015, yana zuwa a matsayin mai maye gurbin na biyu na Anderson Correia a cikin rashin nasara 2–3 da Arouca.[1] [2]

Hackman ya fara wasansa na farko na ƙwararru a cikin Primeira Liga don Boavista akan 6 Disamba 2015, yana zuwa a matsayin mai maye gurbin na biyu na Anderson Correia a cikin rashin nasara 2–3 zuwa Arouca . [1]

items.sourceText: Emmanuel Ibok Essien Listen was elected Senator for the Akwa-Ibom North West District of Akwa-Ibom State, Nigeria at the start of the Nigerian Fourth Republic, running on the People's Democratic Party (PDP) platform. He took office on 29 May 1999.[1]

targets.targetText: Emmanuel Ibok Essien </img> An zabi Listen An zabi Sanata mai wakiltar Akwa-Ibom Arewa maso Yamma a jihar Akwa-Ibom, Najeriya a farkon jamhuriya ta hudu ta Najeriya, mai neman tsayawa takarar jam'iyyar People's Democratic Party (PDP). Ya fara aiki a ranar 29 ga Mayu 1999. [1]

Emmanuel Ibok Essien An zaɓe shi a matsayin Sanata mai wakiltar Akwa-Ibom Arewa maso Yamma a jihar Akwa-Ibom, Najeriya a farkon jamhuriya ta huɗu ta Najeriya, mai neman tsayawa takarar jam'iyyar People's Democratic Party (PDP). Ya fara aiki a ranar 29 ga watan Mayun 1999. [1]

items.sourceText: Udoma Udo Udoma listen is Nigeria's Former Minister of Budget and National Planning[1] and the son of Late Sir Egbert Udo Udoma. He is also the founding partner of Udo Udoma & Belo Osagie - one of Nigeria's oldest and largest commercial law firms.

targets.targetText: Udoma Udoma </img> saurare tsohon ministan kasafin kudi da tsare-tsare na Najeriya [1] kuma dan marigayi Sir Egbert Udo Udoma . Shi ne kuma abokin kafa Udo Udoma & Belo Osagie - daya daga cikin tsofaffi kuma manyan kamfanonin lauyoyi na kasuwanci a Najeriya. [1]

items.sourceText: Rakotonomenjanahary has played for Academie Ny Antsika, Stade Tamponnaise, Concordia Basel, Old Boys and Sukhothai.[1][8] In 2021 he signed for Port.[9] After playing for JS Saint-Pierroise, he returned to Sukhothai.[1]

items.sourceText: The midfielder began his career with Manzini Wanderers and was in 2008 a half year on loan with South African club Intsha Sporting. He later played for Jomo Cosmos[4] and on loan for Manzini Wanderers. Before joining AS Vita Club he was a Mbabane Swallows F.C. player.[5]

targets.targetText: Dan wasan ya fara taka leda a kulob ɗin Manzini Wanderers kuma a shekara ta 2008 ya kasance a matsayin aro a kungiyar Intsha Sporting ta Afirka ta Kudu. Daga baya ya buga wasa a Jomo Cosmos[1] [2] kuma a kan aro a kulob ɗin Manzini Wanderers. Kafin ya koma AS Vita Club ya kasance dan wasan Mbabane Swallows FC.[3] [4]

items.sourceText: Musharu has played three times for the Zimbabwe national team. His only goal for his nation came in 2013 in a friendly against Malawi.[6] In 2014, he played in both of Zimbabwe's 2015 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers against Tanzania.[7]

targets.targetText: Musharu ya buga wa tawagar kasar Zimbabwe wasa sau uku . Kwallon sa daya tilo ga ƙasar sa ta zo ne a shekarar 2013 a wasan sada zumunci da Malawi.[1] [2] A cikin shekarar 2014, ya taka leda a duka wasannin neman gurbin shiga gasar cin kofin Afrika na 2015 da Zimbabwe ta yi da Tanzania.[3] [4]

Musharu ya buga wa tawagar kasar Zimbabwe wasa sau uku . Burinsa daya tilo ga al'ummarsa ya zo ne a shekarar 2013 a wasan sada zumunci da Malawi . [1] A cikin 2014, ya taka leda a duka wasannin neman gurbin shiga gasar cin kofin Afrika na 2015 da Zimbabwe ta yi da Tanzania . [2]

items.sourceText: On 26 June 2018, Andrade signed with Bulgarian club Cherno More.[2] On 30 July, he made his official debut in a 2–2 away draw against Levski Sofia.[3]

targets.targetText: A ranar 26 ga watan Yuni 2018, Andrade ya sanya hannu tare da kulob din Bulgarian Cherno More.[1] [2] A ranar 30 ga watan Yuli, ya fara halarta a hukumance a wasan da suka tashi 2–2 a waje da Levski Sofia.[3] [4]

items.sourceText: Zé Rui retired in June 2002 at almost 38, after two seasons with amateurs C.D. Beja. For several years he acted as assistant to the Cape Verde national team, even being in charge for the friendly with Portugal on 27 May 2006 after Carlos Alhinho's resignation.[1]

targets.targetText: Zé Rui ya yi ritaya a cikin watan Yuni 2002 yana kusan shekaru 38, bayan kaka biyu tare da CD Beja. Shekaru da yawa ya yi aiki a matsayin mataimaki ga tawagar kasar Cape Verde, har ma da kasancewa mai kula da wasan sada zumunci da Portugal a ranar 27 ga watan Mayu 2006 bayan murabus din Carlos Alhinho. [1]

items.sourceText: In July 2015, he signed a one-year contract with second-tier club Académico Viseu.[3] He then made his professional debut on 6 September by playing a full 90 minutes in a 1–0 win against Santa Clara,[4] and scored his first professional goal on 24 October against Varzim.[5]

targets.targetText: A cikin watan Yuli 2015, ya sanya hannu kan kwangilar shekara guda tare da kulob na biyu Académico Viseu.[1] [2] Daga nan ya fara buga wasansa na ƙwararru a ranar 6 ga Satumba ta hanyar buga cikakken mintuna 90 a cikin nasara 1-0 da Santa Clara,[3] [4] kuma ya zira kwallonsa na farko na ƙwararru a ranar 24 ga watan Oktoba akan Varzim.[5] [6]

items.sourceText: On 4 July 2022, Azerbaijan Premier League club Sumgayit announced the singing of Pereira to a two-year contract, with the option of an additional year.[2]

items.sourceText: The department was created in the early years of the French Revolution through the application of a law dated 22 December 1789, from part of the former province of Franche-Comté. The frontiers of the new department corresponded approximately to those of the old Bailiwick of Amont.

targets.targetText: An kirkiro sashen ne a farkon shekarun juyin juya halin Faransa ta hanyar aiwatar da wata doka da ta samo asali a ranar 22 ga watan Disamban 1789, daga wani yanki na tsohon lardin Franche-Comté . Iyakokin sabon sashen sun yi daidai da na tsohon garin Bailiwick of Amont .

An kirkiro sashen ne a farkon shekarun juyin juya halin Faransa ta hanyar aiwatar da wata doka mai kwanan watan 22 Disamba 1789, daga wani yanki na tsohon lardin Franche-Comté . Iyakokin sabon sashen sun yi daidai da na tsohon Bailiwick na Amont .

items.sourceText: Apollonius, the geometrician, ... came from Perga in Pamphylia in the times of Ptolemy III Euergetes, so records Herakleios the biographer of Archimedes ....

targets.targetText: Apollonius, masanin ilimin lissafi, ... ya fito ne daga Perga a Pamphylia a zamanin Ptolemy III Euergetes, don haka ya rubuta Herakleios marubucin tarihin Archimedes. . . .

items.sourceText: The Omaheke Regional Library is located in Gobabis (situated between Epako Suburb and the Legare Sports Stadium[1]), Namibia, and was opened to the public on November 25, 2014, and dedicated on that day by Minister of Education, Dr. David Namwandi.[2]

items.sourceText: The Narok Museum is a museum located in Narok, Kenya.[2] The museum is dedicated to exhibiting artifacts, relics and paintings of the Maa-speaking communities.[3]

targets.targetText: Gidan kayan tarihi na Narok wani gidan kayan gargajiya ne da ke Narok, Kenya . [1] An sadaukar da gidan kayan tarihin don baje kolin kayan tarihi, kayan tarihi da kuma zanen al'ummomin masu magana da Maa . [2]

items.sourceText: The Central African Republic has seen a decrease in tourism due to its recent history of conflict and unrest, as well as the insecurity in certain areas of the country, particularly the north and northwest.[1][2]

items.sourceText: The Plateau languages are highly typologically and lexically diverse. For instance, Roger Blench (2022) notes that Beromic is more internally diverse than all of West Chadic A3.[3]

items.sourceText: Estelle Akofio-Sowah is a Scottish born, Ghanaian businesswoman and the current CSquared Ghana Country Manager and former Google Ghana country manager.[1] Estelle was once the managing director of BusyInternet,[2] an internet service provider in Ghana.[3]

items.sourceText: In 2019, Asmarino described Vanessa as "one of the most prominent human rights activists Eritrea has ever known."[8] As of 2021[update], Vanessa is a campaigner of Amnesty International for the Horn of Africa.[6]

items.sourceText: He is the cousin and brother in law of Ali Ibrahim Dabaiba, previously the mayor of Misrata and head of state-owned development contractor LIDCO during the Gaddafi era, who was in 2012 on a list of sanctioned officials, subject of an Interpol red notice and arrested in 2014. He is estimated to have embezzled as much as $7 billion at 2011 rates from contracts LIDCO had issued under his leadership, per Suisse secrets.[9][20]

items.sourceText: Effendi began photographing in 2001 and became a full-time photographer in 2005 after quitting her job as an Economic Development Specialist at the United States Agency for International Development in Baku. Effendi's first monograph Pipe Dreams, published by Mets & Schilt, focuses on how the oil industry effected the lives of ordinary citizens in Azerbaijan, Georgia and Turkey along the Baku–Tbilisi–Ceyhan pipeline. She initially got a commercial assignment from BP, the oil consortium that operates this pipeline from Azerbaijan via Georgia to the southern Turkish port of Ceyhan. While photographing this promotional material, she discovered that just a small percentage of urban population in her country is benefiting from the oil boom. Over the course of 6 years this work was turned into Pipe Dreams.[2][3]

targets.targetText: Effendi ta fara daukar hoto ne a shekara ta 2001 kuma ta zama mai daukar hoto na cikakken lokaci a shekara ta 2005 bayan ta bar aikinta a matsayin kwararriyar Ci gaban Tattalin Arziki a Hukumar Raya Kasa da Kasa ta Amurka a Baku. Littafin farko na Effendi Pipe Dreams, wanda Mets & Schilt ya buga, ya mai da hankali kan yadda masana'antar mai ta yi tasiri ga rayuwar talakawa a Azerbaijan, Georgia da Turkiyya tare da bututun Baku-Tbilisi-Ceyhan . Da farko ta samu aikin kasuwanci daga kamfanin mai na BP, kamfanin mai da ke gudanar da bututun mai daga Azerbaijan ta Georgia zuwa tashar jiragen ruwa ta Ceyhan ta kudancin Turkiyya. Yayin da take daukar hoton wannan kayan talla, ta gano cewa, kaso kadan na al'ummar birane a kasarta ne ke cin gajiyar karuwar man fetur. A cikin tsawon shekaru 6 wannan aikin ya zama Mafarki na Pipe . [1] [2]

items.sourceText: Her second novel, The Red Book (Hyperion/Voice, 2012), was a New York Times bestseller. The book was long-listed for the 2013 Women's Prize for Fiction.[13] In 2016 and 2017, she released two nonfiction books, The ABCs of Adulthood and The ABCs of Parenthood, in collaboration with illustrator Randy Polumbo.[14][15]

items.sourceText: Igwe (meaning "Sky"), // (listeni) is a royal title or method of addressing traditional rulers that control autonomous communities in Igboland. In other words, Igbos approximate the term to the HM style. An Igwe is therefore defined as a holder of a title of respect and honor in Igboland. Such a person is otherwise known as an Eze. The foremost and one of the most respected Igwe's in Igboland is Igwe of Nnewi, Igwe Kenneth Onyeneke Orizu III.

targets.targetText: Igwe (ma'ana "Sky" ), // ( saurara )</link> sarauta ce ko kuma hanyar yin magana da sarakunan gargajiya waɗanda ke iko da al'ummomin masu cin gashin kansu a ƙasar Igbo . Ma'ana, Igbos suna kusantar kalmar zuwa salon HM . Don haka ana ayyana Igwe a matsayin mai riko da daraja a ƙasar Igbo . Irin wannan mutumin kuma ana kiransa da Eze . Na gaba kuma daya daga cikin mafi daraja Igwe a kasar Igbo shine Igwe na Nnewi, Igwe Kenneth Onyeneke Orizu III .

Igwe (ma'ana "Sky"),// (saurara)</link> sarauta ce ko kuma hanyar yin magana da sarakunan gargajiya waɗanda ke iko da al'ummomin masu cin gashin kansu a ƙasar Igbo.Ma'ana,Igbos suna kusantar kalmar zuwa salon HM.Don haka ana ayyana Igwe a matsayin mai riko da daraja a ƙasar Igbo.Irin wannan mutumin kuma ana kiransa da Eze.Na gaba kuma daya daga cikin mafi daraja Igwe a kasar Igbo shine Igwe na Nnewi,Igwe Kenneth Onyeneke Orizu III.

items.sourceText: Many objects can serve the purpose of iyi-uwa, including stones, dolls, hair or pieces of the dead child's clothes, omens, or offerings. The iyi-uwa must be found and destroyed in order for the ogbanje to rest and stop haunting the mother. To find the object, shamans known as 'dibia' question the spirit and perform rituals to force it to reveal where the iyi-uwa is located.[2]

targets.targetText: Abubuwa da yawa na iya cika manufar iyi-uwa, gami da duwatsu, tsana, gashi ko guntuwar tufafin yaron da ya mutu, alamu, ko hadaya . Dole ne a nemo iyi-uwa a lalatar da shi domin ogbanje ya huta, ya daina addabar uwa. Don gano abin, shamans da aka fi sani da 'dibia' suna tambayar ruhin kuma suna yin al'ada don tilasta shi ya bayyana inda iyi-uwa yake. [1]

Abubuwa da yawa na iya cika manufar iyi-uwa,gami da duwatsu,tsana, gashi ko guntuwar tufafin yaron da ya mutu,alamu,ko hadaya.Dole ne a nemo iyi-uwa a lalatar da shi domin ogbanje ya huta,ya daina addabar uwa.Don gano abin,shamans da aka fi sani da 'dibia' suna tambayar ruhin kuma suna yin al'ada don tilasta shi ya bayyana inda iyi-uwa yake.[1]

items.sourceText: Malaʻefoʻou, formerly Mua, is a village in Wallis and Futuna. It is located in Mua District on the southeast coast of Wallis Island.

targets.targetText: Malaʻefoʻou,tsohon Mua,ƙauye ne a Wallis da Futuna.Tana cikin gundumar Mua a kudu maso gabashin gabar tsibirin Wallis.
Mala ʻ ʻ ou, tsohon Mua, ƙauye ne a Wallis da Futuna . Tana cikin gundumar Mua a kudu maso gabashin gabar tsibirin Wallis .

items.sourceText: The village lies between Leava, the district seat, and Vaisei. Its major building is the church of Sausau (French: Eglise de Sausau).

targets.targetText: Ƙauyen yana tsakanin Leava, kujerar gundumar, da Vaisei . Babban gininsa shine cocin Sausau ( French </link> ).

items.sourceText: The Ramena River is a river of northwestern Madagascar in the region of Diana. It has its sources at the Maromokotra and is the main affluent of the Sambirano River.[1] Its outlet is situated at Ambodimanga Ramena.

targets.targetText: Kogin Ramena kogin arewa maso yammacin Madagascar ne a yankin Diana . Yana da tushen sa a Maromokotra kuma shine babban wadatar kogin Sambirano . [1] Wurin fita yana nan a Ambodimanga Ramena .
Kogin Ramena kogin arewa maso yammacin Madagascar ne a yankin Diana.Yana da tushen sa a Maromokotra kuma shine babban wadatar kogin Sambirano.[1] Wurin fita yana nan a Ambodimanga Ramena.

items.sourceText: The Sopo river rises on the border with the Central African Republic, and flows in a generally northeast direction past the town of Sopo. to join the Boro River on the border with Northern Bahr el Ghazal. The combined stream is the Magadhik River, which in turn joins the Chel River to form the Lol River, a tributary of the Bahr al-Arab.[1]

targets.targetText: Kogin Sopo yana tasowa ne a kan iyaka da Jamhuriyar Afirka ta Tsakiya,kuma yana gudana ta hanyar arewa maso gabas gaba daya bayan garin Sopo.don shiga kogin Boro da ke kan iyaka da Bahr el Ghazal ta Arewa.Ruwan da aka haɗe shi ne kogin Magadhik,wanda shi kuma ya haɗu da kogin Chel don samar da kogin Lol,wani rafi na Bahr al-Arab.[1]

Ruwan da aka haɗe shi ne kogin Magadhik, wanda shi kuma ya haɗu da kogin Chel don samar da kogin Lol, wani rafi na Bahr al-Arab . [1]

items.sourceText: Shaddad worked in the Omdurman Teaching Hospital 1961-1964 where he became a senior specialist in obstetrics and gynaecology, and then a director. His contributions extended to the Council of the Sudanese Medical Association, where he actively participated for several sessions from 1961 to 1964.[1]

Gudunmawarsa ta ba da gudummawa ga Majalisar Ƙungiyar Likitoci ta Sudan, inda ya taka rawar gani don zama da yawa daga 1961 zuwa 1964. [1]

items.sourceText: In 1965, he became a Fellow of the American Society of Agricultural Engineers, Fellow Institute of Food Technology (IFT, USA) in 1969, member of American Society for Heating, Refrigeration and Air-Conditioning Engineering (ASHRAE) in 1970, and a Fellow of the Nigerian Academy of Science[1][2]

items.sourceText: In 1996, along with Barbara Adams,[1] she began working as co-director of the American Hierakonpolis Expedition,[2] which had been on a 4-year hiatus following the death of the former director Walter Fairservis.[3]

items.sourceText: El-Tom has published over 50 papers on integration convergence,[11] approximations,[12] and interpolation.[13][14] His work also focuses on the state and future of mathematics education[15] and mathematical research in Sudan,[1][16] Islamic countries,[17] Africa,[18] and North America.[19]

targets.targetText: El-Tom ya wallafa fiye da 50 takardu akan haɗin kai, [1] kimanin, [2] da interpolation . [3] [4] Har ila yau, aikinsa ya mayar da hankali kan yanayi da makomar ilimin lissafi [5] da bincike na lissafi a Sudan, [6] [7] Ƙasashen Islama, [8] Afrika, [9] da Arewacin Amirka. [10]

items.sourceText: In the run-up to the 2023 general elections, he was appointed as the Taraba State Coordinator of the Tinubu/Shettima Presidential Campaign Council[11] which saw the emergence of President Bola Ahmed Tinubu as the President, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.

A gabanin ƙaratowar zaɓen 2023, an naɗa shi a matsayin kodinetan ƙungiyar yakin neman zaɓen Tinubu/Shettima na jihar Taraba [1] wanda ya ga fitowar shugaban ƙasa Bola Ahmed Tinubu a matsayin shugaban ƙasa, kuma babban kwamandan Sojojin Tarayyar Najeriya.

items.sourceText: Creason started her own business, Ottawa Air Training and Transport in 1967.[1] She also worked for 13 years as an aviation instructor for Grand Haven High School and Muskegon Community College.[5] Creason participated in the Powder Puff Derby in 1972[6] and her fifth race was in 1983.[7]

items.sourceText: Refaat Alareer (Arabic: رفعت العرعير, romanized: Rifaʿat al-ʿAriʿīr; 23 September 1979 – 6 December 2023) was a Palestinian writer, poet, professor, and activist from the Gaza Strip.

items.sourceText: Appointed director of the Pascal Institute in the Ivory Coast in 1972, she now forms part of the scientific committee responsible for monitoring progress on COVID-19, the only woman member.[1][2]

items.sourceText: Penelope Moore is a virologist and DST/NRF South African Research Chair of Virus-Host Dynamics at the University of the Witwatersrand[1][2] in Johannesburg, South Africa and Senior Scientist at the National Institute for Communicable Diseases.[3]

items.sourceText: Swai was born in 1954 in the village of Vudee in the Same District, Kilimanjaro. She attended secondary schools in the 1970s, and graduated in 1980 from the University of Dar es Salaam with degrees in chemistry and statistics.[2]

items.sourceText: In 1985, Swai was awarded a Master of Science in chemical engineering from the Queen Mary University of London.[3] She earned her PhD in biomaterials from the same university in 2000.[2]

items.sourceText: Tola-Binyeri is a district in the Mayo Belwa local government area of Adamawa State, Nigeria. It stretches alongside the Shebshi Mountain. It has a District Head.

items.sourceText: The Udi-Nsukka Plateau is a pair of nearly connected plateaus located in south central Nigeria. Coal was discovered there in 1909. Udi-Nsukka people are Igbo people.

items.sourceText: 122 is an 2019 Egyptian psychological horror film directed by Yasir Al Yasiri and written by Salah Al-Goheny, and produced by Saif Oraibi. The film is the first Egyptian movie to be shot in 4DX technology.[1]

items.sourceText: Share’ Al-Bahlawan (Arabic: شارع البهلوان, lit. "Acrobat Street") is an Egyptian comedy film released on December 12, 1949. The film is directed by Salah Abu Seif, features a screenplay co-written by Mahmoud Farid and Hamada Abdel Wahab, and stars Camelia, Kamal el-Shennawi, and Lola Sedky.[1]

items.sourceText: It starred Nikki Samonas,[3][4] Joselyn Dumas, Christabel Ekeh and Jasmine Baroudi.[3] At the 2015 Golden Movie Awards, the performance of Samonas and Baroudi won them nominations for best TV series actress, while Senanu Gbedawo and James Gardner were nominated for best TV series actor.[5] Samonas and Baroudi were again nominated at the 2016 Golden Movie Awards.[6]

[4] Samonas da Baroudi an sake zaɓar su a 2016 Golden Movie Awards. [5]

Tauraro tauraro Nikki Samonas, [1] [2] Joselyn Dumas, Christabel Ekeh da Jasmine Baroudi. [3] A 2015 Golden Movie Awards, wasan kwaikwayon na Samonas da Baroudi sun lashe zaben fitattun 'yan wasan kwaikwayo na TV, yayin da Senanu Gbedawo da James Gardner aka zaba a matsayin mafi kyawun wasan kwaikwayo na TV. [4] Samonas da Baroudi an sake zabar su a 2016 Golden Movie Awards . [5]

items.sourceText: After a rash decision, Hadj Benmoussa sets off for Europe and embarks on an adventure in attempt to find his ex-wife and her new husband in order to remarry her.[8][9]

items.sourceText: The film had its world premiere as a work in progress on 28 April 2004 as part of "Ten Years Of Freedom - Films from the New South Africa," a festival held in New York City.[1]

items.sourceText: Marrabenta Stories is a 2004 documentary film directed by Karen Boswall.[1] A musical documentary, it covers Marrabenta, the national music of Mozambique.[2]

targets.targetText: Labarun Marrabenta fim ne da aka shirya shi a shekarar 2004 wanda Karen Boswall ya jagoranta. [1] Shirin kiɗa, ne da ya ƙunshi Marrabenta, kiɗan ƙasa na Mozambique. [2]

items.sourceText: The film continues with the story of the market women from the prequel, Wives on Strike, who are now battling against domestic abuse after one of them is killed by her husband, which prompts another strike by the women against their husbands.[4] With their rallying call; "want some sex?", then speak up against domestic violence, the women were able to force the hands of their husbands to stand up for what is right and curb domestic violence.[5][3]

targets.targetText: Fim din ya ci gaba da ba da labarin yadda matan kasuwar ‘yan kasuwan ‘yan kasuwa, matan da ke yajin aiki a halin yanzu ke fama da cin zarafi a gida bayan da mijinta ya kashe daya daga cikinsu, lamarin da ya sa matan suka sake yajin aikin ga mazajensu. [1] Tare da kiran nasu; "so wani jima'i?", sa'an nan kuma magana game da tashin hankali a cikin gida, matan sun iya tilasta hannun mazajensu su tsaya ga abin da yake daidai da kuma hana tashin hankali a cikin gida. [2] [3]

[1] Tare da kiran nasu; "kana son jima'i?", sa'an nan kuma magana game da tashin hankali a cikin gida, matan sun iya tilasta hannun mazajensu su tsaya ga abin da yake daidai da kuma hana tashin hankali a cikin gida. [2] [3]

items.sourceText: In 2017, he was the victim of a robbery on the night of 3 June 2017 in Grand-Popo in the Mono department, where the crime was committed by a police officer on duty in Lokossa and a soldier on duty at the Grand-Popo Naval Base.[4]

items.sourceText: Machérie Ekwa Bahango (born 1993) is a filmmaker from the Democratic Republic of the Congo.[1] Her first feature film Maki’la premiered at the Berlinale 2018.[2] Her movie Sema advocated for women's rights and thematised the issue of sexual violence .[3] It won an award as "Best International Film" at the DC Independent Film Festival 2020 in Washington.[4]

targets.targetText: Machérie Ekwa Bahango (an haife ta a shekara ta 1993) 'yar wasan fim ce daga Jamhuriyar Demokradiyyar Kongo. [1] Fim ɗin ta na [2] farko Maki'la ya fara ne a Berlinale 2018. [3] Fim ɗin ta Sema ya ba da shawara ga haƙƙin mata kuma ya shafi batun tashin hankali na jima'i. [4] Ya lashe lambar yabo a matsayin "Fim na Duniya mafi kyau" a bikin fina-finai na DC Independent Film Festival 2020 a Washington.

Machérie Ekwa Bahango (an haife ta a shekara ta 1993) 'yar fim ce daga Jamhuriyar Demokradiyyar Kongo . [1] Fim dinta [2] farko Maki'la ya fara ne a Berlinale 2018. [1] [3] dinta Sema ya ba da shawara ga haƙƙin mata kuma ya shafi batun tashin hankali na jima'i . [1] [4] lashe lambar yabo a matsayin "Fim na Duniya mafi kyau" a bikin fina-finai na DC Independent Film Festival 2020 a Washington . [1]

items.sourceText: He was born in Ndola. He was previously married to popular Zambian songstress, Saboi Imboela.[3] They later divorced where Imboela revealed domestic violence from Owas.[4] However, Owas later denied the allegations and false rumors regarding he and Imboela.[5]

items.sourceText: Zulumoke initiated The Inkblot Women In Film (IWIF) which was set up to deal with issues of women in film industry.[5][6] Alongside Chinoza Onuzo and Damola Adewale, she launched a podcast titled Inkblot's Meet and Greet in 2021.[7]

items.sourceText: Michael Kasajja is a Ugandan actor, model, choreographer and dancer.[1] He debuted as a lead actor in the 2015 film Bala Bala Sese alongside his erstwhile girlfriend Natasha Sinayobye.[2]

targets.targetText: Michael Kasajja ɗan wasan kwaikwayo ne na ƙasar Uganda, samfurin, mai tsara wasan kwaikwayo kuma mai rawa. [1] [2] fara fitowa a matsayin dan wasan kwaikwayo a fim din 2015 Bala Bala Sese tare da tsohuwar budurwarsa Natasha Sinayobye . [1]

items.sourceText: Emmanuel Apea, Jr. is a Ghanaian TV and film director, 2008 winner of the Africa Movie Academy Award for Best Director.

items.sourceText: In 2014 Elma appeared in the TV miniseries The Red Tent and the film Madness. The following year, she appeared in the film Killing Jesus and the FX series Tyrant.

items.sourceText: Hatim Ammor (born August 29, 1981) is a Moroccan singer.[1] He performed at the Expo 2020.[2] Ammor was born in 1981 in Hay Mohammadi.[3] His wife, Hind Tazi, was diagnosed with cancer on 2019.[4] Ammor is a brand ambassador of Oppo.[5]

targets.targetText: Hatim Ammor (an haife shi a watan Agusta 29, 1981) mawaƙin Morocco ne. [1] Ya yi a Expo 2020 . [2] An haifi Ammor a shekara ta 1981 a Hay Mohammadi . [3] Matarsa, Hind Tazi, ta kamu da cutar kansa a shekarar 2019. [4] Ammor jakadan alama ne na Oppo . [5]

items.sourceText: John Riber is an Indian-born Zimbabwean filmmaker and producer.[1] He is best known for directing the 2000 Zimbabwean comedy drama Yellow Card.[2][3][4]

items.sourceText: Stanfield was born on 8 July 1983 in Cape Town, South Africa.[4] She completed her education from Muizenberg High School. In 2005, she graduated with a BA in Theatre and Performance (Hons. Equivalent) from the University of Cape Town (UCT).[5]

[2] A shekara ta 2005, ta kammala karatu tare da BA a cikin gidan wasan kwaikwayo da wasan kwaikwayo (Hons. Equivalent) daga Jami'ar Cape Town (UCT).

items.sourceText: The plot centers on a man who uses science to become King Imad al-Din's vizier. Threatened by Imad al-Din's jealousy, the scientist foments war between Imad al-Din and Noureddin, a jailed former king.[1]

targets.targetText: Makircin ya ta'allaka ne kan mutumin da ke amfani da kimiyya ya zama wazirin Sarki Imad al-Din. Da yake barazanar kishin Imad al-Din, masanin kimiyyar ya haifar da yaki tsakanin Imad al-Din da Noureddin, tsohon sarki da aka daure. [1]

Labarin fim ɗin ya ta'allaka ne kan mutumin da ke amfani da kimiyya ya zama wazirin Sarki Imad al-Din. Da yake barazanar kishi da Imad al-Din, masanin kimiyyar ya haifar da yaki tsakanin Imad al-Din da Noureddin, tsohon sarki da aka ɗaure. [1]

items.sourceText: Tamara Nokulunga Jozi (12 December 1956 – 6 August 2021), was a South African actress and television personality. She is best known for commercial advertisement "the Wimpy", where she keeps asking "Thabo, when are you getting married?".[1][2]

items.sourceText: Naidoo is a Hindu by religion. She dated reality TV contestant Ismail Hendricks, who appeared on the show, The Apprentice South Africa, in 2005.[1] She married Mark Sandler in December 2009, but divorced in 2011.[8]

items.sourceText: Senzokuhle Radebe (born 29 April 1993) is a South African actor best known for his supporting role as Sthembiso “Sthe” Gumede on the SABC2 soap opera Muvhango,[1] Abednego on Isono,[2] as well as his role as Zibuko on Gomora.[3]

items.sourceText: Anelisa Phewa (born 3 May 1983), is a South African actor, singer, dancer and musician.[1][2] He is best known for the roles in the films Attack on Darfur, Themba and More Than Just a Game.[3]

items.sourceText: Madinatou Rouamba (born 1 December 2001) is a Burkinabé professional football defender, who plays in the Turkish Women's Super League for Fatih Karagümrük in Istanbul.[1] She is a member of the Burkina Faso women's national team.[2]

items.sourceText: Lilian Nyiti (born 3 June 1959) is a Tanzanian middle-distance runner. She competed in the women's 800 metres at the 1980 Summer Olympics.[1]

items.sourceText: In 1956 they introduced the Unatap range of spray mixing taps. These were used to save water – thought to be 5,500 gallons of hot water per washroom per year. They were developed in conjunction with the Building Research Establishment.

targets.targetText: A shekara ta 1956 sun gabatar da kewayon Unatap na tarwatsawar tarwatsawa. An yi amfani da waɗannan don adana ruwa - ana zaton su ne lita 5,500 na ruwan zafi a kowane gidan wanka a kowace shekara. An haɓaka su tare da Cibiyar Binciken Gine-gine.

items.sourceText: There are many political bodies which also feature minority group rights, which might be seen in affirmative action quotas or in guaranteed minority representation in a consociational state.

items.sourceText: Caoilfhionn Gallagher KC is an Irish-born barrister at Doughty Street Chambers in London, specialising in human rights and civil liberties.[1][2][3]

targets.targetText: Caoilfhionn Gallagher KC barrister ce an haife ta a Irish a Doughty Street Chambers a Landan, ƙwararriya ce a fannin kare haƙƙin ɗan adam da 'yancin ɗan adam. [1] [2] [3]
Caoilfhionn Gallagher KC barrister ne haifaffen Irish a Doughty Street Chambers a Landan, ƙwararre a haƙƙin ɗan adam da 'yancin ɗan adam . [1] [2] [3]

items.sourceText: As a child, al-Kashif felt more comfortable around girls than boys.[1] At age 6, she had recurring dreams in which she wore a wedding dress.[2] Al-Kashif first learned about transgender people through a negative comment made by her sister about actress Hanan al-Tawil, the first openly transgender Egyptian actress.[2]

targets.targetText: Lokacin da take yarinya, al-Kashif ta fi jin daɗi a wajen 'yan mata fiye da maza. [1] A shekaru 6, ta yi mafarkai a cikin abin da ta sa wani kaya a bikin aure. [1] Al-Kashif ta fara koya game da masu canza jinsi ta hanyar mummunan sharhi da 'yar'uwarta ta yi game da 'yar wasan kwaikwayo Hanan al-Tawil, 'yar wasan kwaikwayo ta Masar ta farko a fili da ta canza jinsi. [1]

Lokacin yaro, al-Kashif ya fi jin daɗi a wajen 'yan mata fiye da maza. [1] A shekaru 6, ta yi mafarkai mafarkai a cikin abin da ta sa wani bikin aure dress. [1] Al-Kashif ya fara koya game da masu canza jinsi ta hanyar mummunan sharhi da 'yar'uwarta ta yi game da 'yar wasan kwaikwayo Hanan al-Tawil, 'yar wasan kwaikwayo ta Masar ta farko a fili ta canza jinsi. [1]

items.sourceText: Makera is the Kaduna South Local Government Area headquarters, a part of the city of Kaduna, the capital of Kaduna State in Southern Kaduna, Middle Belt, Nigeria.[1] The postal code of the area is 800.[3]

targets.targetText: Makera nan ne hedikwatar karamar hukumar Kaduna ta Kudu, wani yanki ne na birnin Kaduna, babban birnin jihar Kaduna a Kudancin Kaduna, a yankin Middle Belt, Najeriya. [1] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 800. [2]
Makera hedikwatar karamar hukumar Kaduna ta Kudu, wani yanki ne na birnin Kaduna, babban birnin jihar Kaduna a Kudancin Kaduna, Middle Belt, Najeriya . [1] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 800. [2]

items.sourceText: Her first husband was her cousin, Zayd ibn al-Khattab,[2] who was at least twenty years older than herself. He was also a Muslim,[3]: 294  and it was presumably in his company that Atika joined the general emigration to Medina in 622.[1]: 186 [2]

targets.targetText: Mijinta na farko shi ne dan uwanta, Zayd ibn al-Khattab, wanda ya fi girmeta da shekaru ashirin.[2] Ya kuma kasance Musulmi, [1]:: 294  kuma mai yiwuwa a cikin tarayya dashi ne Atika ta shiga cikin ƙaura zuwa Madina a cikin shekara ta 622.[3]: 186 [2]

Mijinta na farko shi ne dan uwanta, Zayd ibn al-Khattab, wanda ya fi kanta shekaru ashirin.[2] Ya kuma kasance Musulmi, [1]:: 294  kuma mai yiwuwa a cikin kamfaninsa ne Atika ya shiga cikin ƙaura zuwa Madina a cikin 622.[3]: 186 [2]

items.sourceText: JED is a member of the International Freedom of Expression Exchange, a global network of non-governmental organisations that monitors freedom of expression worldwide and defends journalists, writers, internet users and others who are persecuted for exercising their right to freedom of expression.

targets.targetText: JED memba ne na Kasuwancin 'Yancin Magana na Duniya, cibiyar sadarwa ta duniya ta kungiyoyi masu zaman kansu waɗanda ke sa ido kan' 'yancin faɗar albarkacin baki'yancin faɗar albarkacin baki' yan jarida, marubuta, masu amfani da intanet da sauransu waɗanda ake tsananta musu saboda yin amfani da haƙƙinsu na' yancin fadin albarkacin baki.

JED memba ce na Kasuwancin 'Yancin Magana na Duniya, cibiyar sadarwa ta duniya ta kungiyoyi masu zaman kansu waɗanda ke sa ido kan 'yancin faɗar albarkacin baki, yan jarida, marubuta, masu amfani da intanet da sauransu waɗanda ake tsananta musu saboda yin amfani da haƙƙinsu na' yancin fadin albarkacin baki.

items.sourceText: In Francophone West Africa it is known as gato in Guinea and Mali (from the French gateau) and beignet in Senegal and Cameroon, as well as in The Gambia. A common Senegalese variety uses millet flour rather than wheat.[3] Cameroonians accompany beignets with beans.[2]

targets.targetText: A yammacin Afirka ana kiranta gato a Guinea da Mali (daga ƙofar Faransa ) da beignet a Senegal da Kamaru da kuma Gambia . Iri-iri na Senegal gama gari yana amfani da garin gero maimakon alkama . [1] Mutanen Kamaru suna raka beignets da wake. [2]

A yammacin Afirka ana kiranta gato a Guinea da Mali (daga French gateau) da beignet a Senegal da Kamaru da kuma Gambia. Iri-iri na Senegal gama gari yana amfani da garin gero maimakon alkama. [1] Mutanen Kamaru suna raka beignets da wake. [2]

items.sourceText: Odinga has run for President of Kenya five times, with none of his attempts being successful. Each time, Odinga has alleged electoral fraud.[4]

targets.targetText: Odinga ya tsaya takarar Shugaban kasar Kenya sau biyar, ba tare da wani yunkurinsa ya yi nasara ba. Kowace lokaci, Odinga ta yi zargin zamba a zabe.[1]
Odinga ya tsaya takarar Shugabancin kasar Kenya sau biyar, ba tare da wani qoqarin samun nasara ba. Kowanne lokaci, Odinga yana zargin anyi magudin a zabe.[1]

items.sourceText: Lasary is a type of Malagasy salad. It is believed that the dish originates from northern Madagascar.[1] The dish is also named Antsary or Ansary in some places.[1]

targets.targetText: Lasary wani nau'in salad ne na Malagasy. An yi imanin cewa abinci ya samo asali ne daga arewacin Madagascar. [1] A wasu wurare kuma ana kiran abincin da Antsary ko Ansary. [1]
Lasary wani nau'in salatin Malagasy ne. An yi imanin cewa tasa ta samo asali ne daga arewacin Madagascar . [1] A wasu wurare kuma ana kiran tasa Antsary ko Ansary. [1]

items.sourceText: In the mountains, it is made up of green beans, cabbage, carrots and onion in a vinaigrette sauce. In urban areas, it is made with pickled mangoes and lemons.[4]

targets.targetText: A cikin duwatsu, ana yin shi da koren wake, kabeji, karas da albasa a cikin miya na vinaigrette. A cikin birane, ana yin shi da mangwaro da lemo. [1]
A cikin duwatsu, an yi shi da koren wake, kabeji, karas da albasa a cikin miya na vinaigrette . A cikin birane, ana yin shi da mangwaro da ƙwaya da lemo . [1]

items.sourceText: In 2002, in Rabat the former Moroccan League for Child Protection was reorganize into the “Center Lalla Meryem for abandoned children”.[8] That same year, on October 22, 23 and 24, Lalla Meryem chaired the work of the Euro-Mediterranean Conference on children's rights and human security,[9] which was held in Marrakesh and attended by representatives of international organizations such as UNESCO, UNICEF, WHO, the European Union, the European Parliament, the Arab Parliament and national actors concerned.[9]

targets.targetText: A shekara ta 2002, a Rabat an sake tsara tsohuwar ƙungiyar Morocco ta Kare Yara zuwa "Cibiyar Lalla Meryem don yara da aka watsar".[1] A wannan shekarar, a ranar 22 ga Oktoba, 23 da 24, Lalla Meryem ta jagoranci aikin Taron Yuro-Mediterranean kan 'yancin yara da tsaron ɗan adam, wanda aka gudanar a Marrakesh kuma wakilan kungiyoyin kasa da kasa kamar UNESCO, UNICEF, WHO, Tarayyar Turai, Majalisar Tarayyar Larabawa da' yan wasan da suka shafi sun halarci taron. [2][2]

A shekara ta 2002, a Rabat an sake tsara tsohuwar ƙungiyar Morocco don Kare Yara a cikin "Center Lalla Meryem don yara da aka watsar".[1] A wannan shekarar, a ranar 22 ga Oktoba, 23 da 24, Lalla Meryem ta jagoranci aikin Taron Yuro-Mediterranean kan 'yancin yara da tsaron ɗan adam, wanda aka gudanar a Marrakesh kuma wakilan kungiyoyin kasa da kasa kamar UNESCO, UNICEF, WHO, Tarayyar Turai, Majalisar Tarayyar Larabawa da' yan wasan da suka shafi. [2][2]

items.sourceText: She left the High Authority for Atomic Energy of Niger in 2021 and in March 2021 she became the Director of the International Data Centre at the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test Ban Treaty Organization in Vienna.[1]

targets.targetText: Ta bar Babban Hukumar Kula da Makamashin Nukiliya ta Nijar a cikin 2021 kuma a cikin Maris 2021 ta zama Darakta a Cibiyar Kula da Bayanai ta Duniya a Kungiyar Yarjejeniyar Hana Nukiliya-Test Nukiliya a Vienna. [1]

Ta bar Babban Hukumar Kula da Makamashin Nukiliya ta Nijar a cikin shekara ta 2021 kuma a cikin watan Maris 2021 ta zama Darakta a Cibiyar Kula da Bayanai ta Duniya a Kungiyar Yarjejeniyar Hana gwajin Nukiliya a Vienna. [1]

items.sourceText: She is also a member of the International Academic Board and is the Co-Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kyiv School of Economics, Kyiv, Ukraine.[5]

targets.targetText: Ita ma memba ce a Hukumar Ilimi ta Duniya kuma ita ce Co-Shugaban Kwamitin Gudanarwa na Makarantar Koyon Tattalin Arziki ta Kyiv, Kyiv, Ukraine. [1]
Har ila yau, memba ne na Kwamitin Ilimi na Duniya kuma ita ce Co-Chairman Kwamitin Daraktoci na Makarantar Tattalin Arziki ta Kyiv, Kyiv, Ukraine . [1]

items.sourceText: Máire was born in Rathmines in 1879 and attended Muckross Park College and Royal University (later the NUI) where she was a classmate of Agnes O'Farrelly, Helena Concannon, and Hanna Sheehy-Skeffington.

targets.targetText: An haifi Máire a Rathmines a cikin 1879 kuma ya halarci Kwalejin Muckross Park da Jami'ar Royal (daga baya NUI ) inda ta kasance abokin karatun Agnes O'Farrelly, Helena Concannon, da Hanna Sheehy-Skeffington .

An haifi Máire a Rathmines a cikin shekarar 1879 kuma ta halarci Kwalejin Muckross Park da Jami'ar Royal (daga baya NUI) inda ta kasance abokin karatun Agnes O'Farrelly, Helena Concannon, da Hanna Sheehy-Skeffington.

items.sourceText: On 26 January 1957, Bouazza was instructed to plant a bomb in the Coq Hardi bar, a popular venue for the affluent French Algerians. She managed to escape the attention of the guards and leave the bomb inside. The explosion caused four deaths while some sixty were injured. Regarded as a heroine by the Algerians, she was arrested as a terrorist by the French.[1]

targets.targetText: A ranar 26 ga watan Janairun 1957, an umurci Bouazza da ta dasa bam a mashaya Coq Hardi, sanannen wurin da attajiran Faransawan Aljeriya suke. Ta yi nasarar tserewa daga hankalin masu gadi ta bar bam ɗin a ciki. Fashewar ta yi sanadiyar mutuwar mutane huɗu yayin da wasu sittin suka jikkata. Mutanen Aljeriya suna kallonta a matsayin jaruma, Faransawa sun kama ta a matsayin ‘yar ta’adda. [1]

A ranar 26 ga Janairun 1957, an umurci Bouazza da ya dasa bam a mashaya Coq Hardi, sanannen wurin da attajiran Faransawan Faransanci. Ta yi nasarar tserewa daga hankalin masu gadi ta bar bam din a ciki. Fashewar ta yi sanadiyar mutuwar mutane hudu yayin da wasu sittin suka jikkata. Mutanen Aljeriya suna kallonta a matsayin jaruma, Faransawa sun kama ta a matsayin ‘yar ta’adda. [1]

items.sourceText: Lesabe died in 2011 and was denied hero status but was given state funeral.[5] From 2003 until her death she was placed on the United States sanctions list.[6]

targets.targetText: Lesabe ta mutu a shekara ta 2011 kuma an hana ta matsayinta na jaruma amma anyi mata jana'iza a jiharta. [1] Daga shekara ta 2003 har zuwa mutuwarta an sanya ta a cikin jerin Takunkumin Amurka.[2]
Lesabe ya mutu a shekara ta 2011 kuma an hana shi matsayin jarumi amma an ba shi jana'izar jihar.[1] Daga shekara ta 2003 har zuwa mutuwarta an sanya ta a cikin jerin Takunkumin Amurka.[2]

items.sourceText: Grace Freedom Kwiyucwiny, also Grace Kwiyucwiny, is a Ugandan politician who serves as the State Minister for Northern Uganda in the Ugandan Cabinet. She was appointed to that position on 6 June 2016.[1] She also served as the woman Member of Parliament representing the Zombo District.[2]

targets.targetText: Grace Freedom Kwiyucwiny, ko kuma Grace Kwiyucwiny, 'yar siyasa ce 'yar ƙasar Uganda wacce ke aiki a matsayin Ministar Arewacin Uganda a majalisar ministocin Uganda. An naɗa ta a wannan matsayi a ranar 6 ga watan Yuni 2016. [1] Ta kuma kasance mace 'yar majalisa mai wakiltar gundumar Zombo. [2]

Grace Freedom Kwiyucwiny, kuma Grace Kwiyucwiny, 'yar siyasa ce 'yar Uganda wadda ke aiki a matsayin Ministar Arewacin Uganda a majalisar ministocin Uganda . An nada ta a wannan matsayi a ranar 6 ga Yuni 2016. [1] Ta kuma kasance mace ' yar majalisa mai wakiltar gundumar Zombo . [2]

items.sourceText: Nyirabashitsi joined the public service as Assistant Town clerk of Kisoro town council. In 2021, she contested the role of woman member of parliament of Kisoro District and won against incumbent Rose Kabagyeni.[1] Nyirabashitsi was appointed Minister of State for Gender, Labour and Social Development (Children and Youth Affairs) replacing Florence Nakiwala Kiyingi.[2] She was affiliated with the National Resistance Movement.[6]

targets.targetText: Nyirabashitsi ta shiga aikin gwamnati a matsayin mataimakiyar magatakarda na ƙaramar hukumar Kisoro. A cikin shekarar 2021, ta tsaya takara a matsayin mace 'yar majalisa ta gundumar Kisoro kuma ta yi nasara a kan mai ci Rose Kabagyeni. [1] An naɗa Nyirabashitsi Ƙaramar Minista mai kula da Jinsi, Kwadago da Ci gaban Jama'a (Yara da Matasa) wacce ta maye gurbin Florence Nakiwala Kiyingi. [2] Tana da alaƙa da jam'iyyar National Resistance Movement. [3]

Nyirabashitsi ya shiga aikin gwamnati a matsayin mataimakin magatakarda na karamar hukumar Kisoro . A cikin 2021, ta tsaya takara a matsayin mace 'yar majalisa ta gundumar Kisoro kuma ta yi nasara a kan mai ci Rose Kabagyeni . [1] An nada Nyirabashitsi Karamar Minista mai kula da Jinsi, Kwadago da Ci gaban Jama'a (Yara da Matasa) wanda ya maye gurbin Florence Nakiwala Kiyingi . [2] Tana da alaƙa da National Resistance Movement . [3]

items.sourceText: In 2006, she was awarded a Bachelor of Education degree, followed three years later by a Master of Education Planning and Administration degree, both from Uganda Christian University, in Mukono.[1]

targets.targetText: A cikin shekarar 2006, an ba ta digiri na farko a fannin ilimi, sannan bayan shekaru uku ta sami digiri na biyu na Master of Planning and Administration, duka daga Jami'ar Kirista ta Uganda, a Mukono. [1]
A cikin 2006, an ba ta digiri na farko na ilimi, sannan bayan shekaru uku ta sami digiri na biyu na Master of Planning and Administration digiri, duka daga Jami'ar Kirista ta Uganda, a Mukono . [1]

items.sourceText: The town was formed from the town of Cato in 1821 after a bitter political dispute about whether to break up Cato. The town of Conquest was formed at the same time and also given a name celebrating the split.

targets.targetText: An kafa garin ne daga garin Cato a shekarar 1821 bayan wata takaddama ta siyasa game da ko za a raba Cato. An kafa garin Conquest a lokaci guda kuma an ba shi suna don murnar raba garin.
An kafa garin ne daga garin Cato a cikin 1821 bayan wata takaddama ta siyasa game da ko za a raba Cato. An kafa garin Conquest a lokaci guda kuma an ba shi suna don murna da rabuwa.

items.sourceText: Anthony Kobina Woode was born on 1 February 1923.[1] A trade unionist, he actively participated in the movement for independence in the Gold Coast, later to become Ghana.

targets.targetText: An haifi Anthony Kobina Woode a ranar 1 ga Fabrairu 1923. [1] Dan kungiyar kwadago, ya taka rawa sosai a yunkurin neman 'yancin kai a gabar tekun Gold, daga baya ya zama Ghana .
An haifi Anthony Kobina Woode a ranar 1 ga Fabrairu 1923. [1] Ɗan kungiyar kwadago, ne ya taka rawa sosai a yunkurin neman 'yancin kai a gaɓar tekun Gold Coast, daga baya ta zama Ghana.

items.sourceText: Two primary roads reach Damasak. One heads south to Gubio and Maiduguri, the capital of Borno State, and the other heads east towards Kukawa and Baga.

targets.targetText: Hanyoyi biyu kanana sun isa Damasak. Daya daga kudu zuwa Gubio da Maiduguri, babban birnin jihar Borno, dayan kuma yayi dodar zuwa Kukawa da Baga .
Hanyoyi biyu na farko sun isa Damasak. Daya daga kudu zuwa Gubio da Maiduguri, babban birnin jihar Borno, da sauran shugabannin gabas zuwa Kukawa da Baga .

items.sourceText: The Nigeria "UK Tourists" national team prior to their tour of the UK in 1949. The team were known among the West African nations at the time as the "Red Devils" due to their red shirts.

targets.targetText: Tawagar 'yan wasan "Masu yawon bude ido ta Burtaniya" ta Najeriya kafin ziyarar da suka yi a Ingila a 1949 An san ƙungiyar a cikin ƙasashen Afirka ta Yamma a lokacin da sunan "Red Devils" saboda jajayen riguna.

items.sourceText: Ahmed studied in numerous part of the world; a fellowship on Conflict Resolution at the University of York (UK) in 2009, Diploma in organizational leadership from Oxford University (UK) in 2015. He also obtained GMP from Harvard Business School, in 2011.[5]

Ahmed yayi karatu a ɓangare da yawa na duniya; misali kan warware rikice-rikice a Jami'ar York (Birtaniya) a cikin 2009, Yayi Diploma a fannin jagoranci daga Jami'ar Oxford (UK) a 2015. Ya kuma sami GMP daga jami'ar Harvard Business School, a 2011. [1]

items.sourceText: Jumoke Akindele is a Nigerian lawyer and first female Speaker of the Ondo State House of Assembly.[1] She was succeeded by Rt. Hon. Bamidele Oleyelogun.

targets.targetText: Jumoke Akindele lauya ce a Najeriya kuma mace ta farko da ta fara zama kakakin majalisar dokokin jihar Ondo . [1] Rt ne ya gaje ta. Hon. Bamidele Oleyelogun.
